# preferredRenderingAPI

**Type Property**

The rendering API to use for rendering the view (for example, Metal or OpenGL).

## Declaration

```swift
static let preferredRenderingAPI: SCNView.Option
```

## Discussion

The value for this key is an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSNumber] object containing one of the values listed in [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNRenderingAPI]. You can also set this option from the inspector in Interface Builder.

SceneKit attempts to initialize a view using the preferred API you specify in the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView] initializer; if the current device does not support the preferred API, SceneKit automatically falls back to a supported API. After initialization, use the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneRenderer/renderingAPI] property to find out whether a fallback occurred. For example, if you specify the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNRenderingAPI/metal] option when initializing a view on an iOS device that does not support Metal, SceneKit defaults to the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNRenderingAPI/openGLES2] option instead.

## View Options

- **preferLowPowerDevice**: An option for whether to select low-power-usage devices for Metal rendering.
- **preferredDevice**: The device to use for Metal rendering.
